history.text: hey user two, have you seen this film/
yes I have
I remember always being fascinated by this character
Yeah it was pretty amazing how believable he was in every role he played. I guess that is why he got away with it for so long
Was he the one that was a surgeon and a airline pilot?
Yeah and the FBI tried for a long time to catch him
What was Chris walker's role taht is completely forgotten
Oh he was Dad i see
His dad
I liked when he found a little southern lady to marry
tell me about that, this is a old movie now
He goes to Louisiana I believe and meets a young lady. Wins over her father and eventually marries her

Also I think I know how Frank gets deeper into his con life. I knew an art student who practised by doing Rembrandt pen and iunk drawings. Then he started selling them for 15 bucks . A forger at the end. Hah
So similarly, Frank just fakes it to make it and becomes a check forger.
Yep, its funny that once they finally get him they get him to help them catch other cons.
because he was that good
like kackers
hackers
I meet fakers all the time
Yeah I think Carl ends up being fond of Frank. They end up as friends
Carl sees the art in it and has that grudging respect we give really good scammers.
I wonder if Frank ever saw that girl again
That is unlikely as most women would be put off that lying to everyone was eventually what he woud do to her. I had a nephew we nicknamed Prevaricator cause of constant fibbing
but he loved her
he didnt lie to her
Yeah, but he was unreliable in a sense because he was wedded to this weird world approach,bet he would have been a great secret agent.
But hey it says he earned millions of dollars after because he was creating unforgeable checks
which I dont know how you would create an unforgable check
I gotta get his how to book.
By the way that quote saying how this was a forgettable Spielberg movie is way off i think
a film that took off like a hare on speed ends like a winded tortoise haha
My girlfriend in AZ years ago had a tortoise as a pet and it "escaped", they found it three miles away weeks later. can't underestimate them and their like
Wow
I know!
